intro: Galium hupehense var. molle, commonly known as soft-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
